title: Nymans Gardens Walking Route

images.title: Colin Smith / Nymans Pinetum
images.caption: Nymans Pinetum. Ornamental and showy pines in various shades of green at Nymans Garden.

images.title: Colin Smith / Heath Garden, Nymans
images.caption: Heath Garden. Purple and white winter heather blooming beside purple blossom.

images.title: Colin Smith / Nymans Garden
images.caption: The south-east corner of the gardens has sweeping views over the Sussex High Weald, an area of rolling fields and woodlands.

images.title: Colin Smith / Crocuses at Nymans
images.caption: Crocuses. Colourful verge beside the southern entrance to the Wall Garden. In the background are blooming camelias

images.title: Colin Smith / Spring at Nymans
images.caption: Blooming daffodils line the path to the weather-boarded shop.

images.title: Colin Smith / Rose Garden, Nymans
images.caption: Rose Garden. Bare pergolas frame one of the few statues which were uncovered on an early spring morning.

images.title: Andy Potter / Woodland walk at Nymans
images.caption: Woodland walk at Nymans. The National Trust has opened up the woodlands on the south side of the Cuckfield Road to visitors. Access from the main site is via the gate by Lodge House.

description: Explore the gardens and woodland walk of this delightful estate on this short route in Handcross, near Haywards Heath. You'll pass through meadows filled with wild flowers and the rock garden planted with alpines. There are also peaceful woodland walks with pools, streams and a Arboretum to enjoy. Access to the woodland walks is free and located behind the car park. The house is also fascinating - it was partially destroyed by fire in 1947, but the ruins of the gothic mansion remain. The Handcross Walk starts from the village and takes you to the nearby Hyde Estate.
